snippet: A title agreement gives the indigenous people ownership of nearly 4,000 square miles of their traditional land.
abstract: Honduran government grants more than 7 percent of its territory to indigenous Miskito communities living on the land, initiative intended to help protect and preserve region's forests.
lead_paragraph: A title agreement gives the indigenous people ownership of nearly 4,000 square miles of their traditional land.

headline.main: Honduras Grants Land to Indigenous Group, in Bid to Help It Protect Forests
headline.print_headline: Honduras Grants Land to Indigenous Group, in Bid to Help It Protect Forests
